nicolas.baly@... wrote:

> I try to find a method to filter the crawl.log file in order to detect 
> streaming
> media files. There is an interesting parameter using Heritrix's 
> status-code.
> Indeed code 0 always provides a streaming protocol URL (rstp://, 
> mms://), see
> attachment. As code -7 which mostly provides file:// mailto:// URLs.
>
> I wonder which is the difference between these two status-code 0 and -7.
> As one can see in the user manual:
> 0 Fetch never tried (perhaps protocol unsupported or illegal URI)
> -7 URI recognized as unsupported or illegal
>
What version of Heritrix are you using? (Probably 1.4.0).  Are you using 
the AdaptiveRevisitFrontier?  Would explain why you're getting these 
codes in lib (I'm having difficulty explaining their presence in the 
crawl.log otherwise -- perhaps others can).

In general we shouldn't be scheduling schemas that are not listed as a 
value on the org.archive.crawler.datamodel.UURIFactory.schemes line from 
heritrix.properties (e.g. http, https, dns).

Yours,
St.Ack


> Thanks,
>
> Nico
